SportsScienceBiomechanicsOfCombatSports.reasoning_for_revised_probability: After reviewing all group deliberations, my position is further reinforced. All forecasters—across coaching, betting, sports science, and psychology—either explicitly endorse a 0% probability or criticize even the slimmest nonzero assignment as unwarranted. Every analysis reiterates the hard UFC protocol, public confirmation of Walker's withdrawal, and lack of even hypothetical, let alone evidential, pathways back to the original matchup. There are no new facts, rumors, or precedents to justify an upward revision. The group’s arguments only add further rigor: this is a textbook zero-probability scenario under the given resolution criteria.

PsychologySportsPsychologyStressPerforma.reasoning_for_revised_probability: Reviewing both my Phase 1 reasoning and the group deliberation, every participating forecaster—across psychology, MMA coaching, sports science, and betting analytics—arrived at the same overwhelming consensus: Johnny Walker's withdrawal is final and universally corroborated by credible reporting, the UFC's own fight promotion, and historical practice. Critiques of probabilistic hedging (e.g., assigning a 1%) powerfully reinforced the argument that there is no evidence-based tail risk left to price in, as neither logistical nor psychological signals suggest even a remote chance of a Walker return. Nothing in the discussion warrants deviating from a strict zero. The evidence, both factual and procedural, supports absolute certainty.

PsychologyMentalResilienceInCompetitiveS.reasoning_for_revised_probability: After reviewing group deliberation, my confidence in the initial zero probability is reinforced. All other experts—across MMA tactics, sports betting, sports science, and psychology—concur that the fight's cancellation is final and there is no evidence of a possible reversal. Critiques of assigning a nonzero probability (e.g., 1%) are compelling; they rightly emphasize UFC operational precedent, logistical inertia, and total lack of any signals for a late switch. No new evidence or logical challenge justifies movement away from my initial position. Therefore, my probability remains unchanged.

question_details.title: Will Johnny Walker defeat Azamat Murzakanov at UFC 316?
question_details.description: Please see [UFC Stats](http://ufcstats.com/fight-details/dab807a99d295832) for statistical details of the two opponents.
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if Johnny Walker defeats Azamat Murzakanov at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).
question_details.fine_print: If Walker does not fight anyone at UFC 316 or fights someone else, this resolves as No.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Dvalishvili on Plans After O'Malley Rematch: 'I Want to Stay Active'**
UFC champion Merab Dvalishvili plans to have four fights in 2025. 'I'm feeling very relaxed about my upcoming rematch, but I know Sean O'Malley will change his strategy. This fight will be financially beneficial for me, as O'Malley is the most popular fighter in the division. I think he'll start with body shots, for example. After the rematch, I want to stay active. I'm planning to have two more fights this year, maybe in Guadalajara and New York. I'm in good shape and want to stay busy to avoid distractions,' Dvalishvili said. The title fight between O'Malley and Dvalishvili will headline UFC 316, which will take place on June 7-8 in Newark, New Jersey. Dvalishvili previously defeated O'Malley by unanimous decision in their first fight. Dvalishvili also won a unanimous decision against Umar Nurmagomedov in January. O'Malley is returning to take the title from Dvalishvili.
Original language: ru
Publish date: May 25, 2025 06:11 PM
Source:[Sports.ru](https://www.sports.ru/boxing/1116757589-dvalishvili-o-planax-posle-revansha-o-melli-rasschityvayu-provesti-esh.html)

**O'Malley Spars with Adesanya Ahead of UFC 316 Rematch**
Former UFC bantamweight champion Sean O'Malley recently sparred with former UFC middleweight champion Israel Adesanya. O'Malley is set to face current bantamweight champion Merab Dvalishvili at UFC 316 on June 9 in New Jersey, USA. This will be a rematch for the two fighters. Adesanya's last fight was at UFC Fight Night 250 on February 1 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, where he lost to Nassourdine Imavov via knockout in the second round.
Original language: ru
Publish date: May 25, 2025 03:48 PM
Source:[championat.com](https://www.championat.com/boxing/news-6026068-o-melli-sparringuet-s-adesanej.html)

**Merab Dvalishvili's Injury Raises Concerns Ahead of UFC 316**
Merab Dvalishvili, a Georgian mixed martial artist, has suffered an injury to his right foot, just two weeks before his highly anticipated fight against Sean O'Malley at UFC 316. Dvalishvili shared a photo of his foot on Instagram, joking, 'It's okay, I'll just cut it off.' This is not the first time Dvalishvili has suffered an injury before a big fight, but he has always managed to push through. The injury occurred during a sparring session with undefeated boxer Cameron Sandoval. Dvalishvili joked, 'Why did you break my little toe, friend?' Sandoval replied, 'You did! You kicked me in the head and broke your own toe. It's your fault.' Although both fighters took the incident lightly, it could potentially affect the UFC 316 event. If Dvalishvili is forced to withdraw, the UFC would need to find a new main event at short notice. Dvalishvili previously defeated O'Malley in September, dominating the fight with a unanimous decision. He also defeated Umar Nurmagomedov in January, who was considered a major threat. However, Dvalishvili's foot injury may now threaten his chances of winning against O'Malley at UFC 316.
Original language: es
Publish date: May 25, 2025 10:38 AM
Source:[as](https://as.com/masdeporte/polideportivo/merab-preocupa-con-una-lesion-a-dos-semanas-del-ufc-316-n/)

**Merab Dvalishvili comes clean on rematching "humble" Sean O'Malley at UFC 316**
Merab Dvalishvili is set to defend his bantamweight title against Sean O'Malley at UFC 316 on June 7. Dvalishvili, who dominated O'Malley in their first fight at UFC 306, is aiming for a definitive finish in the rematch. According to Dvalishvili, O'Malley has become 'humble' and is no longer talking disrespectfully, but Dvalishvili is looking to win with even more dominance. Dvalishvili's coach, John Wood, believes that the rematch will be 'tricky' due to O'Malley's likely adjustments, but is confident in Dvalishvili's skill set to overcome any new challenges. Dvalishvili last competed at UFC 311 in January, where he secured a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov, marking his first successful defense of the bantamweight title.
Original language: en
Publish date: May 24, 2025 03:05 PM
Source:[Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/mma/news-merab-dvalishvili-comes-clean-rematching-humble-sean-o-malley-ufc-316)

**Umar Nurmagomedov's Path to the Title: Who Will Be His Next Opponent?**
Umar Nurmagomedov has not been in the spotlight since his loss to Merab Dvalishvili, but he is planning to return to the title contention soon. The question is, who will be his next opponent? The optimal option is Petr Yan, who is currently ranked above Umar in the rankings and needs one more win to get a title shot. However, Yan is being considered for a fight against Marcus McGee, and it's unclear if he will accept the fight. Another option is Song Yadong, who is scheduled to fight Rob Font in August, but it's unclear if he will be able to recover and prepare for a fight with Umar in October. Other potential opponents for Umar include Dvalishvili's opponent in their previous fight, Sean O'Malley, but this is unlikely. Umar's other options include a fight against Patrick Mix, who is making his UFC debut at UFC 316, or a fight against Davison Figueiredo, who is recovering from an injury. However, it's unclear if any of these fights will materialize.
Original language: ru
Publish date: May 24, 2025 10:15 AM
Source:[championat.com](https://www.championat.com/boxing/article-6024250-umar-nurmagomedov-kto-sleduyuschij-sopernik-poslednij-boj-rejting-ufc-chempion-ufc-v-legchajshem-vese-boj-s-petrom-yanom.html)

**Coach Dvalishvili: 'Merab will fight despite the injury'**
John Wood, coach of Merab Dvalishvili, is confident that the injury will not prevent his fighter from competing in the upcoming UFC 316 title match against Sean O'Malley. 'I'm sure he broke his toe... But that's nothing compared to some of the things we've dealt with in many fights. Merab will go out and do his job, no matter what', Wood said. Dvalishvili had previously shown the extent of his injury on social media. The title fight between O'Malley and Dvalishvili will headline UFC 316, which takes place on June 8 in Newark, USA. O'Malley is returning to take the title from Dvalishvili.
Original language: ru
Publish date: May 26, 2025 06:16 AM
Source:[Sports.ru](https://www.sports.ru/boxing/1116757974-trener-dvalishvili-uveren-chto-merab-slomal-palecz-na-noge-no-eto-vyjd.html)

**'No one like him' ... Joe Rogan questions how Sean O'Malley gets past 'superhuman' Merab Dvalishvili at UFC 316**
Sean O'Malley will face Merab Dvalishvili in the main event of UFC 316 on June 7th, a rematch of their fight at UFC 306 where Dvalishvili won by decision. Dvalishvili is riding a 12-fight win streak and is considered the greatest bantamweight of all time by Henry Cejudo and O'Malley's head coach Tim Welch. UFC commentator Joe Rogan expressed concern for O'Malley, saying 'No one like him' can get past Dvalishvili's 'superhuman' abilities, citing his pressure-heavy wrestling and seemingly unbeatable gas tank. O'Malley is known for his striking, but many predict Dvalishvili's skills will be too much for him, with Dvalishvili being a 3-to-1 betting favorite.
Original language: en
Publish date: May 26, 2025 12:21 AM
Source:[Yardbarker](https://www.yardbarker.com/mma/articles/no_one_like_him_joe_rogan_questions_how_sean_omalley_gets_past_superhuman_merab_dvalishvili_at_ufc_316/s1_17651_42243366)

**Mario Bautista vs. Patchy Mix: Odds and what to know ahead of UFC 316 bout**
Mario Bautista (15-2 MMA, 9-2 UFC) will face Patchy Mix (20-1 MMA, 0-0 UFC) in the main card opener of UFC 316. Bautista, on a seven-fight winning streak, welcomes Mix to the UFC after an injury forced a lineup change. Mix, who was recently released from the PFL, brings an eight-fight winning streak to the octagon and is a -184 favorite according to FanDuel, with Bautista as a +142 underdog. Mix has stopped five opponents in his current run, including Sergio Pettis and Magomed Magomedov, while Bautista has won seven consecutive fights, including a split decision over Jose Aldo.

**UFC 316 PPV fights confirmed with Patchy Mix vs Mario Bautista added to card - FIGHTMAG**
The UFC has confirmed the fights for UFC 316, including a bantamweight title rematch between Merab Dvalishvili and Sean O'Malley, and a bantamweight title defense by Julianna Pena against Kayla Harrison. The card also features a middleweight bout between Kelvin Gastelum and Joe Pyfer, and a welterweight clash between Vicente Luque and Kevin Holland. Additionally, Patchy Mix makes his UFC debut against Mario Bautista, who is riding a seven-fight winning streak. 'It's a great card with some exciting matchups,' said Parviz Iskenderov, the author of the article. 'The fans are in for a treat with these talented fighters.'

**UFC 316: Surging fight-finisher saves light heavyweight clash on Merab Dvalishvili vs. Sean O' Malley 2 card**
Azamat Murzakanov will now face Brendson Ribeiro at UFC 316 after Johnny Walker was forced to withdraw from the event. Murzakanov, who is on a 14-fight win streak, is looking to extend his winning streak to five in New Jersey. He has previously won bonuses for his knockouts against Alonzo Menifield and Tafon Nchukwi. Ribeiro, a former Shooto Brazil champion, has turned his UFC career around with a decision win over Caio Machado and a kimura victory over Diyar Nurgozhay. UFC 316 will take place at Prudential Center and feature a main event rematch between Merab Dvalishvili and Sean O'Malley, as well as a co-headliner between Julianna Peña and Kayla Harrison.

**Walker Withdraws from UFC 316 Fight Against Murzakanov, Ribeiro to Replace Him**
Johnny Walker has withdrawn from his fight against Azamat Murzakanov at UFC 316. He will be replaced by Brendon Ribeiro, according to journalist Leo Gimaeres. Murzakanov (14-0) last fought in August 2024, knocking out Alonzo Menifield. However, he received a 180-day suspension in November 2024 for violating anti-doping rules. Ribeiro (17-7) won against Diar Nurgozhay in March with a second-round submission. Murzakanov suffered a hand injury during his fight against Jake, saying, 'I hit him hard in the head when finishing him off.'

**Azamat Murzakanov Gets New Opponent for UFC 316**
Russian mixed martial artist Azamat Murzakanov (14-0) has been assigned a new opponent for UFC 316, according to insider Leo Gimaeraes. Originally, Murzakanov was set to face Brazilian Johnny Walker, but he declined the fight. Murzakanov's new opponent is Brazilian Brendson Ribeiro (15-7). Ribeiro, 28, has been a professional since 2015 and has a 2-2 record in the UFC. Murzakanov, 36, has been a professional since 2010 and has a 4-0 record in the UFC. 'A new challenge awaits Azamat Murzakanov,' said Gimaeraes, 'let's see how he performs against Brendson Ribeiro.'

Publish date: May 07, 2025 08:08 AM

**Johnny Walker Announced for UFC 316 Against Azamat Murzakanov**
Johnny Walker will face Azamat Murzakanov at UFC 316 on June 7 in Newark, USA. Walker, who has been inactive for nearly a year, will have a tough mission ahead as Murzakanov is undefeated in his professional MMA career with a record of 14-0. Murzakanov, known as 'The Professional', has a strong striking power and has won three of his four UFC fights via knockout or technical knockout. 'He's a very tough opponent,' Walker will likely face, according to the article.

**Murzakanov and Walker to Face Off at UFC 316**
Azerbaijani fighter Azamat Murzakanov (14-0) and American Johny Walker (21-9) will face each other at UFC 316. The event will take place on June 7-8 in Newark, New Jersey. Murzakanov last fought in August 2024, defeating Alonzo Menifield via knockout. However, he received a 180-day suspension in November 2024 for violating anti-doping rules. Walker, on the other hand, lost to Volkan Oezdemir in January via first-round knockout, marking his second consecutive early defeat. Murzakanov broke his hand during a fight with Jake: 'I hit him hard in the head when I finished him.'

Publish date: April 16, 2025 07:48 AM
Source:[Sports.ru](https://www.sports.ru/boxing/1116709071-murzakanov-i-uoker-provedut-poedinok-na-ufc-316.html)

**Azamat Murzakanov to Face Johnny Walker at UFC 316**
Russian fighter Azamat Murzakanov will face Brazilian Johnny Walker at UFC 316 on June 8th, according to the UFC press service. Murzakanov, 36, has been suspended for doping since November 1, 2024, and his suspension will end on May 1. He made his UFC debut in March 2022 and has won all four of his fights. Walker, 33, has been competing in the UFC since 2018, with a record of seven wins and six losses, and one no contest. 'It's a great opportunity for me to get back in the Octagon and show the world what I'm capable of,' said Murzakanov. 'I'm looking forward to facing Johnny Walker and putting on a great show for the fans.'
Original language: ru
Publish date: April 15, 2025 07:44 PM
Source:[sportbox.ru](https://news.sportbox.ru/Vidy_sporta/UFC/spbnews_NI2192425_Diskvalificirovannyj_za_doping_rossijanin_provedet_pojedinok_na_turnire_UFC_316_v_ijune)

**Azamat Murzakanov to Face Johnny Walker at UFC 316**
UFC fighter Azamat Murzakanov (14-0) will face Brazilian Johnny Walker (20-9), ranked 11th in the UFC's 93 kg category, at UFC 316 on June 8 in Newark, New Jersey. According to the UFC press service, Murzakanov, 35, has been undefeated since his professional debut in 2010, and has been competing regularly since 2015. He made his UFC debut in March 2022, winning all four of his fights in the organization. Walker, 32, has been competing in the UFC since 2018, with a record of 7 wins and 6 losses. 'The upcoming fight will be a great test for Azamat,' said the UFC press service, without providing further details.
Original language: ru
Publish date: April 15, 2025 04:43 PM
Source:[championat.com](https://www.championat.com/boxing/news-5976144-azamat-murzakanov-provedyot-sleduyuschij-poedinok-na-turnire-ufc-316.html)

**Marlon Vera vs. Mario Bautista, Johnny Walker vs. Azamat Murzakanov Set for UFC 316**
The UFC 316 lineup has been expanded with the addition of two new bouts: Marlon Vera vs. Mario Bautista at bantamweight and Johnny Walker vs. Azamat Murzakanov. Vera has lost three of his last four fights, while Bautista is on a seven-fight winning streak. Walker is winless in his last three outings, while Murzakanov is undefeated in 14 professional fights but was recently suspended for six months due to an anti-doping violation. Vera said, 'It is unclear why the booking was moved from UFC Des Moines.' Bautista is coming off a split-decision victory over Jose Aldo at UFC 307. Walker was originally scheduled to face Bogdan Guskov at UFC 311 but withdrew due to injury. Murzakanov knocked out Alonzo Menifield in his last Octagon appearance at UFC on ABC 7.
Original language: en
Publish date: April 15, 2025 01:49 PM
Source:[Sherdog](https://www.sherdog.com/news/news/Marlon-Vera-vs-Mario-Bautista-Johnny-Walker-vs-Azamat-Murzakanov-Set-for-UFC-316-196696)
summary: All experts unanimously forecast that Johnny Walker will not defeat Azamat Murzakanov at UFC 316, assigning a probability of 0% or, at most, 1% for a Yes outcome. Across perspectives as varied as mixed martial arts coaching, sports betting analysis, historical fight data, sports science, biomechanics, and sports psychology, every expert points to the confirmed withdrawal of Johnny Walker from the event, as reported by multiple reputable MMA news outlets and UFC event listings. Brendson Ribeiro is now set to face Murzakanov at UFC 316. The experts all note that reversal of such late-stage, officially promoted withdrawals is historically almost unprecedented in UFC practice. Given the strict resolution criteria—that Walker must both fight and defeat Murzakanov at this specific event—all plausible scenarios and available media corroborate that Walker will not compete in the bout, making a Yes resolution all but impossible. Only extremely remote, hypothetically unlikely tail risks (such as a cascade of additional withdrawals and last-minute reinstatement) are acknowledged by a minority of experts, and even then, these probabilities are placed at less than 1%. Therefore, the consensus is that the probability Johnny Walker defeats Azamat Murzakanov at UFC 316 is effectively zero.
